newsitem.title: GERMANY: German 96 primary aluminium output put at 560,000T.
newsitem.headline: German 96 primary aluminium output put at 560,000T.

text.p: Production of primary aluminium in Germany this year was pegged at 560,000 tonnes after 575,155 tonnes last year, aluminium industry association GDA said at a press conference on Tuesday.

GDA president Walter Hueck said this would reflect the effect of the closure of the VAW Toeging smelter in early 1996 and was in no contrast to a 2.5 percent year-on-year increase in first half production at 287,700 tonnes.
VAW, part of utility group VIAG AG, in February phased out the smelter with a nominal capacity of 90,000 tonnes per year, which last ran at 30,000 tpy.
Hueck also said secondary aluminium output in 1996 should match 1995.
Germany accounts for roughly one third of European aluminium output.
It exports 35 percent of production while imports account for 32 percent of the domestic market.
